definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

sentences.english: China, he said, was not trying to spread radical anti-American ideologies.
sentences.chinese: 他说，中国不想散播极端反美意识。

sentences.english: She is a woman who sheds happiness around her .
sentences.chinese: 她是个向周围散播快乐的女人。

sentences.english: Salmonellae are more widespread than is commonly comprehended.
sentences.chinese: 沙门氏菌的散播比平常所了解的更为广泛。

sentences.english: Translucence gives the material the ability to transmit and diffuse light.
sentences.chinese: 半透明给予材质以传送和散播光的能力。

sentences.english: WHO refers to a single fly is the spread of the virus the most simple way.
sentences.chinese: 世卫组织单指搭乘飞机是散播病毒最简单的途径。

sentences.english: So he starts spreading rumors that he is divine himself.
sentences.chinese: 于是他开始散播谣言，说自己是神。

sentences.english: Malefic thoughts spread laziness, procrastination, etc.
sentences.chinese: 不好的想法散播懒惰，拖沓等等。

sentences.english: Journal of Bacteriology advances and disseminates fundamental knowledge of bacteria and other microorganisms.
sentences.chinese: 细菌学期刊促进和散播病毒和其它微生物的基础知识。

sentences.english: We broadcast these moments out to the rest of the world.
sentences.chinese: 我们将这些时刻散播到世界的其他角落。

sentences.english: The cancer may also be spread by open-mouth kissing, Gillison said in the interview.
sentences.chinese: 吉里森在采访中说，而这种癌还会通过接吻散播。

sentences.english: I refuse to  accuse  Fuse of  diffusing  confusion.
sentences.chinese: 我拒绝控告导火索散播混乱。

sentences.english: Spreading a rumor with malicious intent。
They spread a lot of tacky gossip about his love life.
sentences.chinese: 关于他的爱情生活，他们散播了许多不堪的闲言闲语。

sentences.english: Nobody knows how the idea of movable-type printing filtered from Asia to Europe.
sentences.chinese: 没人知道便携式的印刷机是如何从亚洲散播到欧洲的。

definition: to proclaim/to make public or well known
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to start rumours and create trouble
to transmit/to pass on to sb else/(math.) transitive
